sanskrit_verse: पयः पिबेत्त्रिरात्रं वा योजनं वाऽध्वनो व्रजेत् । उपस्पृशेत्स्रवन्त्यां वा सूक्तं वाऽब्।दैवतं जपेत् ॥ ११.१३२॥
transliteration: payaḥ pibettrirātraṃ vā yojanaṃ vā'dhvanō vrajet | upaspṛśetsravantyāṃ vā sūktaṃ vā'b.daivataṃ japet || 11.132||
sph_interpretive_translation: One shall either drink milk for three nights, or traverse a distance of one yojana, or touch flowing water, or chant a Vedic hymn dedicated to the deity.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from conscious capacity to perform purification acts.
Causation is established through sequential purification protocols.
Capacity-based responsibility requires choice among equivalent purificatory actions.
Restoration logic operates through substitution of equivalent spiritual disciplines.
Consciousness alignment occurs via selection and execution of dharmic alternatives.
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent has committed ritual impurity THEN agent MUST execute ONE of: consume milk for three nights OR travel one yojana OR touch flowing water OR chant Vedic hymn.
IF multiple agents involved THEN each agent SHALL independently select ONE purification mode without coercion.
IF selected action is incomplete THEN system SHALL prompt completion within 24-hour cycle until alignment is restored.
IF no action is initiated within 12 hours THEN automatic assignment of first available purification method SHALL occur.
IF agent demonstrates repeated refusal THEN capacity suspension protocol SHALL activate until readiness is confirmed by authorized observer.
supreme_court_application: In matters concerning ritual purity violations, the Supreme Court shall ensure that the respondent selects and completes one of the prescribed purification methods. The court shall verify that the method was executed with full awareness and intent. No punitive measure shall be imposed; only confirmation of completed restoration shall constitute legal closure.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa is satisfied by demonstrable engagement in any one of the specified purification paths. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential alignment through voluntary enactment. Proportional responsibility lies in choosing and completing one act. The non-punitive reality rule confirms that restoration is achieved through conscious participation, not external penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Agent receives structured timeline for executing chosen purification method.
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Agent signs declaration of intent before initiation.
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: If interrupted, agent resumes from point of discontinuation upon readiness confirmation.
Integrity Reintegration Sequence: Upon completion, agent affirms restored alignment under witness.
Readiness Verification Loop: System monitors adherence without punitive intervention, ensuring natural consequence of delay is internal misalignment rather than imposed sanction.
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as the sole Source of Dharma. Justice is executed through restoration, not punishment. Reality aligns with consciousness. Dharma is hereby restored.
